thread.title: This Camera Guy Trying To Film Three Street Fights At Once While Providing Commentary Gets An A+ For Effort And Execution - Barstool Sports
thread.title_full: This Camera Guy Trying To Film Three Street Fights At Once While Providing Commentary Gets An A+ For Effort And Execution - Barstool Sports

author: Chris Spags
title: This Camera Guy Trying To Film Three Street Fights At Once While Providing Commentary Gets An A+ For Effort And Execution - Barstool Sports
text:
This Camera Guy Trying To Film Three Street Fights At Once While Providing Commentary Gets An A+ For Effort And Execution Chris Spags | Email 
The guy who uploaded this one to YouTube calls it the “Best Street Fight of 2017″ which is inherently a dubious claim given that there’s only one Internet Fight Video of the Year award worth its weight in pixels available online. And while the fight itself lacked some of the dramatic flair, sheer athletic performances, or stellar camera work (and titties) of some I’ve posted so far this year. 
But one thing it has going for it is the man behind the camera. This guy’s running all over filming every broken down part of fight shouting about how he’s “tryna be a good cameraman,” motivating the dude to protect his house, telling the brother to jump in and throw some more heat, I’m not even sure if he knew these people or just knew that he was needed in their lives like Bagger Vance but either way there’s no denying his role here. The cameraman is just waiting for a fight to live up to the hype he’s putting out there, one can only hope there’s a next time for him with some dudes with way more enthusiastic fists. 
And even better now we know wheat the voice of those old Under Armour “Will you protect this house?” ads is up to these days: 
I’d like to imagine a world this Under Armour guy, Terry Tate: Office Linebacker, and the reanimated corpse of Spuds McKenzie all have their own new lanes in filming viral fight videos. It’d be a great second career for beloved advertising mascots. Jared from Subway can even do the prison edition or the Kids Say The Darnedest things version. ……I’ve had worse ideas is all I’m sayin. Chris Spags |
